EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as the central storage depot.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-3.0, y=19.0) used for smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-4.0, y=21.0) used for processing copper ore into copper plates.

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System at position (x=-7.5, y=18.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Lab at position (x=-7.5, y=18.5) used for submitting Automation Science Packs.
- New Boiler at position (x=-4.5, y=24.0) with direction UP. It currently shows warnings ["out of fuel", "no input liquid", "no fluid present in connections"] and has replaced the old boiler previously located at (x=-10.5, y=18.0).
- Steam Engine at position (x=-10.5, y=22.5) which converts steam into electrical power; its warnings remain ["not connected to power network", "no input liquid", "no fluid present in connections"].
- Offshore Pump at position (x=-7.5, y=25.5) supplying water to the system.
- Small Electric Pole (part of ElectricityGroup id=83) with supporting poles at positions (x=-7.5, y=15.5) and (x=-8.5, y=21.5) for power distribution.
- Pipe Groups associated with the network:
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=259) at position (x=-10.5, y=16.5), status EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=260) at position (x=-12.5, y=18.5), status EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=263) at position (x=-8.5, y=20.5) carrying water, status FULL_OUTPUT.
Note: Repeated reattempts to connect the new Boiler with the Offshore Pump have not yielded a valid fluid connection.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
- Crafting Dependencies:
  • Confirm that all required sub-ingredients (for example, iron-plate needed for crafting pipes) can be produced using available furnaces or crafting machines before initiating any craft operations.

- Entity Placement and Spacing:
  • Verify that the target tile for an entity placement is unobstructed and within the permitted build range. Adjust spacing, direction, or reference positions to avoid conflicts with existing entities (such as overlapping pipes).
  • When a placement error cites “target position is too far away,” ensure the player is moved within the allowed proximity before attempting placement.

- Undefined Entity References:
  • Define and initialize all required variables (e.g. new_boiler, new_boiler_position) prior to performing operations like rotation or pipe connection to avoid reference errors.

- Buildable Area Calculation:
  • Use correct syntax when computing buildable areas; avoid invoking Position objects as callable entities.

- Fluid Connection Issues:
  • Ensure that fluid connection points between devices (such as between the Offshore Pump and the Boiler) are unblocked and properly aligned. Confirm that pipe routing and coordinate matching enable a valid fluid transfer.

- Inventory Verification:
  • Check that the necessary entities (for instance, a boiler) are present in the inventory before attempting placement, to prevent errors related to inventory shortages.
